alert.note: Alert for Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:29PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington County through 515 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Millry, or 11 miles north of Chatom, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to around 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chatom, Saint Stephens and Millry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
